cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi SSW of San Andres Island, or 210 mi SSE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras on Thursday, re-emerge over the north-western Caribbean on Friday, then accelerate northward through the Gulf of Mexico toward the U.S. Gulf Coast before turning northeast across the southeastern United States.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Nicaraguan coast near Sandy Bay Sirpi
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A – Detroit is more than 850 mi from the forecast track over open water and will only experience the remnant low over land

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect from Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua, northward to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area (Sandy Bay Sirpi to Punta Castilla)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwestern Caribbean coasts of Nicaragua and Honduras first; later the U.S. northern Gulf Coast from eastern Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle is within the 4- to 5-day cone
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed for Great Lakes region (nearest point in table is Danville, VA, >350 mi away)
weather_observation.first_hazard: Start of heavy rainfall (from remnant low)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely – guidance suggests at most 1–2 inches when remnants pass nearby
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible early next week as the weakening remnant low passes south and east of Michigan
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rainfall possible 8–10 Oct; flooding threat low
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river rises and brief visibility reductions during rain showers; no significant marine hazards on the Detroit River expected
